alert.note: Alert for Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Carter, Sullivan, Unicoi and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 PM EDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen and it will take some time for water to drain away. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnson City, Kingsport, Bristol Tn, Elizabethton, Erwin, Jonesborough, Pine Crest, Central, Midway, Oak Grove, Banner Hill, Hampton, Gray, Spurgeon, Unicoi, Bluff City, Watauga, Milligan College, Avondale and Rocky Mount State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
